Title: Improving Oral Contraceptives
Abstract: The goal of this project was to encourage research into oral contraceptives (OCs) and their side effects, as well as to conduct original research into this topic. OCs, commonly known as birth control pills, are known to have a wide range of side effects that are difficult to predict and address. These side effects are underresearched, causing a lack of knowledge for both patients and their healthcare providers. In this project, I investigated the factors behind this lack of research, developed a blueprint for future research by use of a survey that asked participants about their experiences with OCs, designed a tool that patients can use to troubleshoot side effects they experience with OCs, and encouraged further research into this topic.
